items.sentence: I ended up at Tom\'s place after walking around all day.
Why did you have to embarrass me in front of the others?
We can\'t thank you enough for all you\'ve done for Tom.
I never would\'ve imagined Tom would be able to do that.
Tom considered moving to Boston, but decided against it.
Tom shouldn\'t have any trouble finding a place to live.
Tom shouldn\'t have interfered with what Mary was doing.
Tom shouldn\'t have told Mary where he hid the diamonds.
Tom solved all the problems without his teacher\'s help.
I often don\'t express myself as well as I wish I could.
Tom couldn\'t understand why she wanted to learn French.
Tom ordered a beer for himself and a gin tonic for Mary.
Tom plans to catch a flight back to Boston this evening.
Tom plans to move to Boston before the end of the month.
If I\'d left earlier, I wouldn\'t have missed the train.
I always put off doing my homework and get into trouble.
In the 1600s, tea was introduced into Europe from India.
Don\'t forget to take your umbrella when you leave here.
Don\'t give Tom more money than is absolutely necessary.
He had to work as hard as he could to finish it in time.
He woke up to find himself lying on a bench in the park.
I think we should tell Tom that he needs to work harder.
It\'ll take me 20 minutes to get to the station by taxi.
It\'s a lot easier to fall in love than to stay in love.
Tom is usually the one who takes our dog out for a walk.
Tom is very likely going to be hungry when he gets home.
Tom is working toward a master\'s degree in engineering.
Tom isn\'t disciplined enough to do something like that.
You always have to be on your guard against pickpockets.
I\'ll do whatever it takes to get you back into my life.
I\'ve asked you repeatedly not to sing so late at night.
I doubt that Tom would ever consider going to Australia.
Tom\'s daughter as well as his sons all went to college.
I\'d rather spend money on something I\'d actually wear.
Tom\'s dog is still waiting just outside the front door.
You\'re going to thank Tom for the present, aren\'t you?
You\'re the only one I\'d consider going to Boston with.
You\'d be amazed how much time Tom spends playing games.
Tom tells us more about what\'s going on than Mary does.
The jokes you told us the other day weren\'t very funny.
The movie wasn\'t as interesting as I expected it to be.
I waited for the bus for a long time, but it never came.
I can\'t do that now because I\'m not feeling very well.
Do you think Tom and Mary will go to the dance together?
Do you think that Tom would teach French to my children?
Do you think you can write that report without any help?
Do you want to go out dancing with me on Saturday night?
Does Tom still want to go swimming with us next weekend?
How do you think you can make a difference in the world?
Why aren\'t you doing what you\'re supposed to be doing?
